title: Lorraine viewers praise Apprentice star Michelle Dewberry as she opens up about battle with depression and wanting to end her life
text:
TV Magazine 'Gorgeous and brave lady' Lorraine viewers praise Apprentice star Michelle Dewberry as she opens up about battle with depression and wanting to end her life 
The businesswoman recently admitted her suicidal thoughts Video By Kala Paul-Worika 21st February 2017, 9:33 am FANS have praised Apprentice winner Michelle Dewberry for speaking openly about her battle with depression and wanting to take her own life. 
Viewers watching the businesswoman’s interview on Tuesday’s Lorraine hit Twitter in their droves to show their support. WENN Michelle Dewberry has been praised for opening up about her battle with depression Listening to @MichelleDewbs on #Lorraine speaking about her battle with depression. Gorgeous and brave lady #TimetoTalk #mentalhealth 
— Amelia Larard (@AmeliaLarard) February 21, 2017 
One gushed: “Listening to @MichelleDewbs on #Lorraine speaking about her battle with depression. Gorgeous and brave lady #TimetoTalk #mentalhealth”. 
Chatting to host Helen Skelton, who is standing in for Lorraine Kelly , Michelle said: “Being depressed is something you can’t really explain. 
“It was a constant cloud of sadness – I couldn’t get rid of it. I kind of thought it was normal. 
“Everything was good in my life, so I couldn’t even rationalise it.” Well done to @MichelleDewbs for talking openly about her battle with depression. #lorraine 
— Rachel Hawkins (@ourrachblogs) February 21, 2017 Well done @MichelleDewbs for discussing mental health & suicidal thoughts, helping to break the stigma xx #mentalhealth #lookafteryourmind 
— Carla #ncfc #hhho (@MummyCarlaMarie) February 21, 2017 
The 37-year-old added: “Depression doesn’t discriminate. 
“There was no two ways about it, I wanted to die. It was a constant, a certainty. 
“The only thing that stopped me is that I didn’t want to hurt my mum. 
“My mum had already lost a child as my sister died at 20.” related stories 'MY MUM SAVED ME FROM SUICIDE' Former Apprentice winner Michelle Dewberry opens up about her heartbreaking battle with depression 'I WOULDN'T LIVE ANYWHERE ELSE' After becoming UK's City of ­Culture, we take a tour of Hull with Apprentice winner Michelle Dewberry 'I FELT SO ISOLATED' Stranger Things' Shannon Purser admits she used to self-harm as she battled depression 'MY MUM SAVED ME' Stacey Solomon recounts moment she realised she was suffering from post-natal depression TRIP OF A LIFETIME Lorraine Kelly to take three weeks off work to celebrate her 25th wedding anniversary 'the whole package' Lorraine Kelly is in complete awe of The Voice star Stacey Skeete's 'phenomenal' hourglass figure 
And viewers were impressed with her openness on the subject after she revealed to The Sun on Sunday how her mum saved her from the brink of suicide after a battle with depression . 
The Apprentice winner told how she made the decision to end her life after “years and years of unhappiness”. 
“Well done @MichelleDewbs for discussing mental health & suicidal thoughts, helping to break the stigma xx #mentalhealth #lookafteryourmind,” said a fan. 
While another added: “@MichelleDewbs watching you on Lorraine. Thank you for explaining suicide thoughts so well 💛”. 
And: “Well done to @MichelleDewbs for talking openly about her battle with depression. #lorraine”. @MichelleDewbs watching you on Lorraine. Thank you for explaining suicide thoughts so well 💛 
— Gill Taylor (@gilltphoto) February 21, 2017 
Adding that she just wanted “someone to scoop me up and look after me”, after going on anti-depressants and getting therapy Michelle smiled and declared: “I sit here now and I don’t want to die – life’s awesome!” 
Advising those in similar situations, she added: “I don’t take my mental health for granted anymore. 
“It’s essential to like yourself.”
